intro: Fumaria africana var. ochracea, commonly known as the yellow poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are upright and branching. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
